page.title: 06LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: All the land in our sector, mostly arable, slopes down to the River Granta. One prominent feature is the Land Settlement, consisting originally of ten-acre plots farmed by tenants, but now private. Since then some of the houses have been extended. The old railway embankment is clearly visible from the Settlement. The River Granta runs through this sector, is very shallow and liable to flood. There are some old sluice gates near Abington Hall. All electrical cables in Great Abington are underground but, running across the A604,the main trunk road, are huge electriciy pylons. Several B roads are linked to this road which have bridges - Hildersham bridge is hump backed with iron railings, and Great Abington bridge is flat with brick walls. There are two ancient churches - Great Abington church with
